docTitle.titlePart:
Physical characteristics and Chemical compositions of Leaves extracts of
Sorindeia grandifolia Engl. (Anacardiaceae) harvested at Kato, Benin

front.div:
Abstract
The results brought back at the end of this work concern various chemical constituents of S. grandifolia leaves collected in
Benin. The major compounds ( 4%) of essential oils obtained after hydrodistillation and analysis by coupling gas
chromatography with spectrometry mass are constituted of : limonene (20.2%), (E)--ocimene (7.6-17.8%), (Z)--ocimene
(11.4%), -cadinene (7.0%), selin-11-en-4--ol (4.5-5.7% ), palmitic acid (4.3-6.2%), -pinene (5.5%), α-selinene (5.5%), -
phellandrene (5.2%), β-selinene (4.9%), β-elemene (4.5%).The lipidic fractions realized from petroleum ether extracts are
marked by importants rates of arachidic acid (22.5%), palmitic acid (20.3%) and of linoleic acid (15.9 %). The
phytochemical analysis showed relatively a large content of coumarins, gallic tannins, flavones, leucoanthocyans and
saponins in opposition to the other secondary metabolites.
front.keyword: Keywords: limonene, arachidic acid, metabolites, coumarins
